meanings.sent1: The chiks chirped happily in their nest.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of chiks learning to fly.
meanings.sent3: The chiks had a race to see who could fly the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The chiks in the nest were like a symphony of nature.
meanings.sent5: The colorful chiks were a delight to watch.

meanings.definition: To make a sharp, high-pitched sound
meanings.sent1: The kettle began to chiks on the stove.
meanings.sent2: I heard the branches chiks in the wind outside.
meanings.sent3: The old door chiks whenever it's opened quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter chiks through the room like music.
meanings.sent5: The excited puppy's tail chiks against the floor.

meanings.definition: Informal term for young women or girls
meanings.sent1: She is part of a chiks group at school.
meanings.sent2: The chiks at the party were all dancing together.
meanings.sent3: The chiks giggled as they shared stories.
meanings.sent4: Her bright personality made her the chiks of the group.
meanings.sent5: The chiks in the class were all friends.
